fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24747].
  {panel}

Customer reports that it cannot embed videos on Confluence pages, even attach them into the space page and using Multimedia Macro Gadget.

Tried to embed the files, according to [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Embedding+Multimedia+Content], it's possible to play media that has been attached into page.

I couldn't make it work at all. Tried to play the following video formats:

* Video .mov - codec: H264 - MPEG-4 - resolution 1280x800, frame rate 8
* Video .mov - codec: MPEG-4 (mp4v) - resolution 320x240, frame rate 19
* Video .mp4 - codec: H264 - MPEG-4 - resolution 1248x592, frame rate 10
* Video .avi - codec: MPEG-4 (XVID) - resolution 240x150, frame rate 15

Embedded them into spaces according [Documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Embedding+Multimedia+Content], but without success. Tried the following: 

* Firefox 10 + Ubuntu 11.10
* Chrome 17 + Ubuntu 11.10
* Chrome 17 + Windows 7
* Firefox 10 + Windows 7
* Chrome 17 + OS X Snow Leopard
* Safari + OS X Snow Leopard

I experienced "missing plugins" in browsers running under Ubuntu and Windows. Under Firefox running Win7, it asked to download plugin due to security sets in browser. In OS X it worked without "missing plugin" issue, however videos were too large (1280x800) and taken too long to load. When finally loaded it played cropped. Some instances had 10 videos in the same space page. 

Tested with very small videos (240x150 and 320x240) and two embedded media per space page and also doesn't worked.

According [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] the browsers were supposed to work.

Thank you,
Fabiana
fields.summary: Embedded videos on Confluence doesn't load

  {panel}

(Sorry, I couldn't find the project for the Atlassian Plugin SDK, so I've just used Confluence, please move according.)

When reading the altas-* scripts of the SDK I realised that they support an ATLAS_OPTS variable to add/modify the default MAVEN_OPTS, however by running maven in a new Bourne Shell (sh) these aren't passed successfully.

I'm not too sure what the best way to solve this, I've seen that most executable scripts (ant, mvn) tend to use either exec or eval instead of "sh -c".

Temporarily, as I'm unsure, I've simply added the single MAVEN_OPTS to inside the sh command, thus:
Replacing:
sh -c "${MAVEN_EXECUTABLE} ${MVN_PARAMS}"
with:
sh -c "MAVEN_OPTS=\"$MAVEN_OPTS\" ${MAVEN_EXECUTABLE} ${MVN_PARAMS}"
fields.summary: Unable to (successfully) pass maven options (MVN_OPTS) to atlas-* scripts of the plugin SDK

fields.description: This is the improvement description of the client: Some links in the "XXX is following you" email notification are broken when rendered in Lotus Notes 8.5.2/FP1. This email notification presents several links to the reader. The links that are broken included: * each user avatar picture * Network View * Email Settings After viewing the source code of the email I discovered that the email uses a mix of absolute paths and relative paths. The links that work in Lotus Notes are coded as absolute paths. The broken links are all coded as relative paths: Absolute: {code}Manage Notifications{code} Relative: {code}Network View ...{code} It also appears the email uses the HTML convention to resolve relative paths. I suspect Lotus Notes is *not* honoring the HTML tag thus rendering these links broken. Why does the email use a mix of relative and absolute paths? In the case of a notification email I cannot think of a benefit to using relative links. And, in our enterprise case, it seems the relative links are broken when viewed in Lotus Notes. Of the email clients I've tested this issue affects: * Lotus Notes 8.5.2 (client) * Lotus Notes 8.5.2FP1 (client) * iNotes 8.5.1 (web) This issue does not affect: * GMail So, in a nutshell, Confluence should allow to choose which type of URL to have in the email notification: Either Absolute or Relative URLs, but not both mixed.
fields.summary: Some links in the "XXX is following you" email notification are broken when rendered in Lotus Notes

fields.description:
When attempting to insert a link to a Starteam URL (prepended with "starteam://" rather than "http://"), Confluence tries to be smart about the link and strips off the protocol ("starteam:") from the link and treats it like a relative hyperlink to another page in Confluence.

The only work-around I've found is documented here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/31829/confluence-support-non-http-ftp-hyperlinks

Essentially, by creating a shortcut link for Starteam, I can type in "[<server_name>/<rest_of_starteam_link>@starteam] and it returns with a clickable (although not ideal) link that follows the link through.
fields.summary: Starteam Links don't Work in Confluence

fields.description:
Underlines in the rich text editor often fail to get escaped, and thus get treated as italics indicators.

For example, type the following:

<A>_B_<C>

in the rich text section, and then either save or switch to Wiki view.  Either way, you'll see that the result is <A>B<C> with an italicized "B", since the underlines were not escaped.

This makes it a nightmare to edit certain kinds of pages, causing me to resort to editing in an external editor, putting in backslashes manually, and then hoping beyond hope that I won't have to edit the page again.
fields.summary: Underlines in rich text editor interpreted as italics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24684].
  {panel}

Heap sizes for Confluence are set in the system-appropriate SETENV file.
While it makes sense for Confluence to use the specified heap size when starting a new Confluence instance, the shutdown script also uses the minimum heap size.

In case where the minimum heap size is quite large (>50% of physical memory), the shutdown script will be unable to allocate memory when it tries to start. The solution is to have the shutdown script use a fixed minimum necessary amount of heap.
This would prevent users from having to reduce the heap size in setenv temporarily just to run the shutdown script, then reinstate the original heap size when starting Confluence up again.
fields.summary: Confluence should used fixed heap sizes for shutdown scripts

(i) I didn't do a normal upgrade in this case. I hack the 4.1.2 DB by inserting the plain wiki markup to {{BODYCONTENT.BODY}} and set the {{BODYCONTENT.BODYTYPEID}} to 0, and force the wikiToXhtmlMigrationUpgradeTask. h5. This bug has been an issue since upgrading to Confluence 3.5 last month.

We are currently using IE7; if you require more information about the server etc let me know and I'll obtain the information from our IT department,

{code}
The error is straight forward. Confluence 4.1.x (Oracle) already has an index {{ATTCH_IDVER_IDX}} on {{ATTACHMENTDATA (ATTACHMENTID, ATTVERSION)}}.
!ATTACHMENTDATA_Conf41.png!

IMHO, Confluence should drop it first or just skip creating it.

This is related to CONF-15228. But I think this is different because {{ATTCH_IDVER_IDX}} was created by Confluence.

h5. Workaround
# Append the following to your Confluence you're upgrading to [system properties|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties]:
{code}
-Dhibernate.hbm2ddl.skip_creating_missing_indexes=true
{code}
This would skip automatic index creation during the upgrade.
# Re-run Confluence to trigger the upgrade.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24666].
  {panel}

In the old wiki markup editor, it was easy to insert text using all the colours of the rainbow! (using the \{color} macro).

These days, users are restricted to only being able to easily use colours that are available in the colour picker in the editor toolbar. If you want to use a different colour, you have to use the insert wiki markup dialog.

It would be great if there was a way to easily select other colours.  This could be accomplished, for example, by allowing a user or administrator to customise the colours that appear in the picker, or adding an option to the picker that allows an arbitrary colour choice to be typed in.

This was raised by a customer on answers.atlassian.com: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35516/how-do-i-revert-to-the-default-text-color-in-the-confluence-4-x-editor]
fields.summary: It is no longer possible to easily insert text of an arbitrary colour in the new Confluence 4 editor

fields.description:
A lot of odd behavior which I currently believe is linked to the following updates to apache, some of which is specific to openSuse.

http://support.novell.com/security/cve/CVE-2011-4858.html
http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2012-01/msg00038.html
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4858

What happens is that any netwrok traffic that would normally have a space in it is being replaced by a +.  For example, if you create a new page in Confluence with a title that contains spaces the spaces will be replaced with + signs as soon as the page is saved.  How this is related to these updates I am not sure but once removed the behavior returns to normal.

As of the creation of this ticket I am not positive that this is isolated to openSuse or not as I am running into some troubles creating the appropriate environment to test.  I will update here as I complete testing but if you have any questions in the meantime please feel free to contact me.
fields.summary: Errant '+' symbols replacing spaces ' ' in all Confluence traffic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24656].
  {panel}

As a confluence user, I would like to subscribe to changes for a given set of topics (=words).

If you take a look at "Google Alerts" you will understand what is meant here.

I do not want to watch certain spaces or pages (that I have to be aware of). I just want to be alerted if somewhere new content shows up with the topics I'm interested in.

I can imagine, that users can build this functionality with RSS feeds and tools and filters, but this is too complicated for many users. It needs to become a native Confluence feature - easy and intuitive for everybody.

In my eyes this is a key feature many users will appreciate.
fields.summary: Provide Feature "Confluence Alert" analogue to "Google Alert"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24651].
  {panel}

Look at introducing a power user mode for the Confluence RTE. This is to avoid the need to edit the raw storage format via the source editor.

This could include features such as:

* Showing (and possibly editing) various markup indicators
  ** Markup
  ** Meta data, such as macro parameters, link and image URLs/locations
  ** Scope of items such as list items, paragraphs, etc.
* Ability to search and replace meta data (macro parameters, link and image URLs/locations).
* Reducing visual clutter (e.g. render images as small placeholders rather than full size images).
* Inline track-changes - show changes as they're made.

The [Confluence Wiki Markup Styler plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/606145] covers some of this functionality, though has some limitations and some browser specific issues with cursor positioning and movement (really browser bugs that would need working around).
fields.summary: Power User Mode of the Confluence Editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24646].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Create a space named SpaceA
2) Create a page within SpaceA called PageA
3) Attach an image to PageA named ImageA.png
4) On PageA, add a gallery macro containing ImageA.png
5) Export PageA and verify that the full page along with the image were exported with the image available by clicking on the thumbnail
6) Create a space named SpaceB
7) Create a page within SpaceB called PageB
8) On PageB, add a gallery macro for ImageA.png using the syntax: {gallery:include=ImageA.png|page=SpaceA:PageA}
9) Export PageB and notice that the image has not been exported. When the export has been opened in a webbrowser, the thumbnail for ImageA is visible, but cannot be clicked to view the full size.

So, in a nutshell, if you are using a gallery macro that includes an image attachment from other space, I think the correct is to export this image together when exporting the original space where the gallery macro resides.
fields.summary: Exporting an Space to HTML doesn't includes attachments from gallery macros included from other spaces

{code}

h4. Scenario #2
# Create a new LDAP User Directory.
# Ensure to fill something in "Default Group Memberships"
# Test and Save. User Directory will be created successfully.
# One won't be able to edit the User Directory at all once there is a value in "Default Group Memberships" which is very similar to CONF-22469.
# The error thrown is the same as scenario #1

h4. Workaround:
(i) Please *backup* your Confluence database first.
h5. For scenario #1:
# Login with internal admin account
# Remove the LDAP User Directory
# Recreate from scratch with the same settings *and* ensure that you've filled the "Default Group Memberships" with the desired local groups accordingly. 

h5. For scenario #2
You will need to modify any changes manually in the database. The settings are all stored in the {{cwd_directory_attribute}}.conne
fields.summary: Getting System Error page when trying to edit User Directory or adding "Default Group Memberships" in Confluence 3.5.9 or higher for Oracle users

fields.description: The anonymous user only has permissions to view the Wiki, but no add/edit permissions, however they are able to access the labels dialog as if they have those permissions, (see attached screenshot). Fortunately the issue appears to be cosmetic because when the anonymous user creates a new label and presses "add" the label isn't created but it still causes concern and confusion for our users.
fields.summary: Anonymous User is able to access label dialog popup despite not having permission

fields.description:
If you have at least two users directly in a space and use the "Select All" or "Deselect All" Actions all boxes of all users are selected/deselected.
It is not limited to the current user.
It is working correctly in the groups area.

Chrome 17
FF 10
IE 8
fields.summary: Space Permissions -> Individual Users -> Select All -> all(!) boxes are checked

fields.description:
* Go to {{/pages/templates/listpagetemplates.action}}
* Click "Add New Global Template"
* Create a template _without_ adding labels

The template shows and empty Labels list and could do with a general UI improvement/cleanup.
fields.summary: Space templates shows empty Labels list

fields.description:
When I use the documentation theme, the underline in headings appears normally.

!heading2.jpg!

When I change to default theme, the underline disappears.

!heading1.jpg!
fields.summary: The underline in heading doesn't appear in default theme
Export page history in PDF and Word exports

fields.description:
When used the redirect macro and export space to PDF files, this error appears in PDF file: 

Error formatting macro: redirect: java.lang.NullPointerException

Steps to reproduce:

* Go to a page and enter edit mode
* Click the Insert/Edit Macro icon, and select the Redirection macro from the list of macros
* On the Insert 'Redirect' Macro dialog, enter the name of the page in the "{redirect:" field, then click Insert
* To create a PDF of that Space, select Browse / Advanced / PDF Export, then click Export.

This is the result using redirect macro. If I export directly without the redirect macro, this message doesn't appears.

!redirect.jpg!
fields.summary: Redirect macro caused error message in PDF
Incorrect URL translation in JIRA macro
Feature Request: Copy Space Plugin should be able to copy watchers

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description When we try to add header in User Macro that has option rendered body, it will not appear in Page and also html source of the page, despite when you click _View Source_ or _View Storage Format_ from the page, all the header will appear there. If you click view source from web browser, you will find that the header is actually missing from the div tag. h4. Steps to Reproduce # Create 'User Macro' from Admin Console and choose *Rendered* as its Macro Body Processing. # Add this simple div in the template of user macro. {code:html}
$body
{code} # Add the user macro to any page # Add header to the body of macro # Add any Paragraph content on the next line after the header. _Note: If you press *Enter* on paragraph format content the header will be rendered, but if you press *Shift + Enter* the header won't be rendered again._ # The header will not be rendered in Page despite it's being displayed in _View Source_ and _View Storage Format_. h4. Screenshots and Storage format *How it's rendered in page* !usermacro-2.png! *View Storage Format* {noformat} sample macroBLOCK

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 4

Paragraph

 {noformat} *View Source* !usermacro-1.png! h4. Workaround Add a Dummy Paragraph after the desired paragraph. This can be a white space after a line break at the end. This has to have the paragraph formatting. Keep in mind that when adding text to body the default formatting is paragraph. If you selected the added text and click paragraph, it will actually remove the needed formatting.
fields.summary: Adding Header in Rendered body 'User Macro' doesn't work if you put paragraph content after the header
